title: Video 1 :The secret method hackers use to open an external port for life â€” discover what no one knows!
description: In networking, opening ports is essential to facilitate communication between devices and is used in gaming, web services, and remote control. Portmap.io offers a free and easy service to open ports without complexity. Portmap.io features include simple and fast usage, support for TCP and UDP protocols, high reliability for continuous connections, and user data protection. Hackers use it to quickly open ports to ease attacks, hide identity by routing traffic, bypass network restrictions, support multiple protocols, and benefit from an easy-to-use interface with a stable and reliable connection. It works by using NAT technology to route traffic to open ports after registration, making the process smooth and fast. Portmap.io is an effective and simple solution for opening ports, suitable for developers, gamers, and regular users alike.

title: Video 2:Turning a USB flash drive into a cyber weapon
description: networking_intro:In networking, opening ports is essential to facilitate communication between devices and is used in gaming, web services, and remote control. Portmap.io offers a free and easy way to expose local services behind NAT or firewall via secure tunnels.,kali_usb_advantages:Installing Kali Linux on a USB flash drive provides flexibility to use on any device without installation. It enhances security by leaving no trace on host machines. Kali comes preloaded with many penetration testing tools. Setup is easy and fast. You can customize tools and update the system directly from the USB.,persistence_benefits:Enabling persistence on Kali USB saves system changes, installed programs, and personal files. This allows you to reuse your custom setup without reconfiguration each time. It makes Kali Linux more practical and flexible.,kali_installation_strength:Kali Linux strength by installation method: USB flash drive: 7/10 â€” portable and persistent but slower. Hard drive install: 9/10 â€” fast with full resource use and features. Virtual machine: 8/10 â€” isolated and easy to switch but slower due to shared resources.

title: Video 3:Revealing the Secrets of Hackers in Sending Anonymous Messages
description: Tor:definition:A network that hides user identity by routing traffic through multiple volunteer servers worldwide.,benefits:Hide IP address,Bypass censorship,Enhanced privacy,ProtonMail:definition:An encrypted email service that provides end-to-end encryption to protect message contents.,features:Full encryption,No personal info required to sign up,Supports Tor access,TorWithProtonMail:benefits:Hide identity and real location,Protection from censorship and tracking,No need to provide phone number,High privacy level by combining encryption and Tor,limitations:Does not offer complete protection if the user is not careful,OnionAvailableFeature:description:A feature in the Tor browser that indicates if the visited site has a .onion hidden service version.,purpose:Encourages the use of .onion sites for better privacy and security.,advantages:Fully encrypted connection,User and site anonymity,Tracking protection,conclusion:Using Tor with ProtonMail offers excellent privacy, provided the user practices safe behavior and avoids sharing sensitive information.

title: Video 4:How hackers exploit artificial intelligence to locate you and misuse your data: Revealing hidden secrets!
description: definition:An IP address is a digital identifier for any device connected to the internet.,exploitation:by_hackers:approximate geographic location,launch DDoS attacks,exploit vulnerabilities and open ports,eavesdrop on networks,how_hackers_obtain_ip:phishing attacks with malicious links,infected attachments,fake pages,social engineering techniques,protection_methods:use a VPN,keep systems updated,be cautious when using public networks,enable firewalls,tools:Hound:Helps collect personal information from public sources for security or social engineering purposes.

title: Video 5:Network Isolation in VirtualBox: Make Your Virtual System Secure Against Hackers in the World of Cybersecurity
description: Definition:Creating separate virtual network environments to prevent VMs from accessing local network, internet, or other VMs.,Types:NAT:Allows internet with isolation from local network.,Bridged:Connects VM to physical network like a real device.,Internal:VMs communicate only with each other, no internet or physical network.,Host-Only:Host and VMs communicate but no physical network access.,Importance:Security:Prevents hacker access to sensitive systems.,Safe Testing:Allows safe software/system testing without risk.,Management:Easier system management and analysis.,Applications:Used in VirtualBox for testing, learning, research, and security.,Summary:Network Isolation in VirtualBox enhances security and management by separating virtual networks.

title: Video 7:Creating a secret room on the dark web: Steps to build a private space accessible only via a link and an encrypted key
description: onionshare_summary:OnionShare is a secure, anonymous file-sharing and messaging tool on the dark web using Tor, offering secret rooms, no account needed, direct encrypted connections, ease of use, open-source code, anti-tracking, multi-language support, and practical applications for privacy and secure communication; installation involves Tor and OnionShare setup with a known fix, while AES encryption (128/192/256-bit) ensures strong data security.

title: Video 8:The optimal solution to simplify tasks on Kali Linux (500 tools Ã— 1 script)
description: summary:Lazy Script is a Bash-based tool designed to simplify the use of Kali Linux tools in ethical hacking. It provides an easy-to-use interface that allows users to perform tasks like information gathering, network testing, and vulnerability exploitation without the need for complex commands. Key features include: Organized menu for easy navigation. Automatic installation of missing tools. Wide range of supported functions info gathering, Wi-Fi attacks, security settings, etc.. Suitable for both beginners and professionals.,conclusion:Lazy Script is an efficient tool that speeds up and organizes daily tasks on Kali Linux, making it an ideal choice for those looking to automate their security operations easily.

title: Video 9:How I managed to extract a full copy of the FBI website
description: commands:sudo su && apt update && apt upgrade,sudo nano /etc/setoolkit/set.config,report:introduction:SET is an open-source tool developed by Dave Kennedy and integrated into Kali Linux to perform social engineering attacks by exploiting human vulnerabilities instead of technical flaws.,uses:Phishing attacks via fake emails or websites,Targeting individuals or organizations to steal credentials or deliver malware,Creating fake login pages or infected media for phishing,components:Phishing Attacks:Create fake login pages mimicking real sites like Facebook or Google to harvest user credentials.,Spear Phishing:Targeted fake emails sent to specific individuals with malicious attachments or links.,Website Attack Vectors:Inject malicious JavaScript or exploit browser vulnerabilities via infected websites.,Java Applet Attacks:Embed Java applets in webpages to request user permission and exploit their system.,Mass Mailer Attack:Send mass fake emails with links or attachments appearing from trusted sources.,Credential Harvesting:Capture login data via fake pages that look like legitimate websites.,steps:Choose attack type from SET main menu e.g., Social Engineering Attacks, Website Vectors,Configure required options such as email address or fake URL,Execute the chosen attack scenario,strengths:Ease of Use:Text-based interface guides the user step-by-step, suitable even for beginners.,Flexibility:Highly customizable attacks based on the target.,Integration:Can be combined with Metasploit, BeEF, and others.,Target Precision:Effective in both mass and spear phishing scenarios.,dangerous_attacks:Phishing via fake login pages.,Spoofed emails sent to companies or sensitive targets.,Java Applet attacks leveraging old but effective methods.,conclusion:SET is a powerful social engineering toolkit widely used in penetration testing and cybersecurity education. Despite its strength, it must be used ethically and legally.
